restaurants.name: Le Comptoir du Relais
restaurants.description: Classic Parisian bistro serving traditional French dishes. Famous for their duck confit and coq au vin.

restaurants.name: Breizh Café
restaurants.description: Authentic Breton crêpes and galettes. Try the complete galette with ham, cheese, and egg.

restaurants.name: Septime
restaurants.description: Michelin-starred restaurant with innovative seasonal menu. Book months in advance.

restaurants.name: L'As du Fallafel
restaurants.description: Best falafel in Paris. Always a line but moves fast. Cash only.

attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.description: Iconic iron lattice tower. Visit at sunset for best views. Book tickets online to skip lines.
tips: Bring a jacket - windy at top

attractions.name: Louvre Museum
attractions.description: World's largest art museum. Home to Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo. Impossible to see everything in one day.

attractions.name: Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur
attractions.description: Charming hilltop neighborhood with artists, cafes, and stunning basilica. Great views of Paris.
tips: Visit in morning for fewer crowds

attractions.name: Seine River Cruise
attractions.description: Hour-long boat tour past major landmarks. Relaxing way to see the city.

events.name: Jazz at Sunset - Parc de la Villette
events.description: Free outdoor jazz concert series. Bring a picnic blanket.

tips: Metro is fastest way to get around. Buy a carnet (10 tickets) for savings.
Most museums closed on Mondays or Tuesdays. Check before going.
Restaurants serve lunch 12-2pm, dinner after 7:30pm. Plan accordingly.
Many places close in August when locals take vacation.
Learn basic French phrases - locals appreciate the effort.

restaurants.name: Ichiran Ramen
restaurants.description: Famous tonkotsu ramen chain with individual booths for focused eating experience.

restaurants.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
restaurants.description: Fresh sushi and street food near old fish market. Visit early morning for best selection.

restaurants.name: Sukiyabashi Jiro
restaurants.description: 3-Michelin star sushi. Featured in Jiro Dreams of Sushi. Book months ahead.

attractions.name: Senso-ji Temple
attractions.description: Tokyo's oldest temple in Asakusa. Beautiful traditional architecture and shopping street.
tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds

attractions.name: teamLab Borderless
attractions.description: Immersive digital art museum. Stunning interactive installations.

attractions.name: Shibuya Crossing
attractions.description: World's busiest pedestrian crossing. Best viewed from Starbucks above.
tips: Visit at night when lit up
Get a Suica/Pasmo card for trains and convenience stores.
Tokyo is huge - focus on 2-3 neighborhoods per day.
Many restaurants have English menus or picture menus.
Cash is still king - have yen on hand.
Trains stop around midnight - plan accordingly.

restaurants.name: Joe's Pizza
restaurants.description: Classic NY slice. Simple, delicious, no frills. Cash only.

restaurants.name: Katz's Delicatessen
restaurants.description: Legendary Jewish deli since 1888. Famous pastrami sandwich. When Harry Met Sally filmed here.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar
restaurants.description: David Chang's famous ramen spot. Try the pork buns.

attractions.name: Central Park
attractions.description: Massive urban park. Walk, bike, or just relax. Different areas have different vibes.

attractions.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
attractions.description: One of world's greatest art museums. Could spend days here.
tips: Suggested admission - pay what you wish

attractions.name: Brooklyn Bridge Walk
attractions.description: Walk across iconic bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn. Great views.
tips: Go early morning for fewer tourists
Subway is 24/7 and cheapest way around. Get unlimited MetroCard.
Walk between neighborhoods - distances are smaller than they seem.
Avoid Times Square unless you want crowds and overpriced food.
Free ferries give great views of Statue of Liberty.
Brunch is a religion here - expect waits on weekends.
